verses.text: 羊羔揭開了七印的第一個印的時候，我觀看，就聽見四個活物中的一個，發出好像雷轟的聲響，說：「你來！」

words.note: Resultative verb indicating successful hearing.
Refers to the four living creatures in Revelation.
Refers to a loud rumbling sound, like thunder.

verses.text: 我觀看，見有一匹白馬；騎在馬上的拿著弓，有冠冕賜給他，他就出去，得勝並且要再得勝。

words.note: Literal meaning: 'horse-top'.
Indicates a continuous state of holding.
Literally 'obtain victory'.

verses.text: 羊羔揭開了第二個印的時候，我聽見第二個活物說：「你來！」
就另有一匹紅馬出來，騎在馬上的得了權柄，可以從地上奪去和平，使人互相殘殺，又有一把大刀賜給他。

words.note: Indicates something else appeared or existed.
Literal meaning: 'earth-surface'.
Means to kill each other ruthlessly.

verses.text: 羊羔揭開了第三個印的時候，我聽見第三個活物說：「你來！」我觀看，見有一匹黑馬；騎在馬上的，手中拿著天平。

words.note: Literally 'heavenly balance'.

verses.text: 我聽見在四個活物中間，仿佛有聲音說：「一公升小麥賣一個銀幣，三公升大麥賣一個銀幣，油和酒也不可糟蹋。」

words.note: Implies reckless waste or damage.

verses.text: 羊羔揭開了第四個印的時候，我聽見第四個活物的聲音說：「你來！」

words.note: Refers to the Lamb (Jesus Christ) in Revelation.
Refers to the seals in the Book of Revelation.

verses.text: 我觀看，見有一匹灰馬；騎在馬上的，名字叫作「死」。陰間也跟隨著他。他們得了權柄可以管轄地上的四分之一，又要用刀劍、饑荒、瘟疫和地上的野獸去殺人。

words.note: Often translated as 'pale' or 'ashen' horse in Revelation.
Refers to means of warfare or execution.

verses.text: 羊羔揭開了第五個印的時候，我看見祭壇底下，有為了 神的道，並且為了自己所作的見證而被殺的人的靈魂。

words.note: Refers to the Lamb (Jesus Christ) in Revelation.
Refers to the seals in the Book of Revelation.
Often written with an elevated space in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
Refers to God's word or teaching.
Indicates the object of the following verb or the passive voice.

verses.text: 他們大聲喊叫，說：「聖潔真實的主啊！你不審判住在地上的人，給我們伸流血的冤，要到幾時呢？」

words.note: A title for God or Jesus Christ.
Part of the verb-object compound '伸冤' (shēnyuān).
Often used in the compound '伸冤' (to avenge/right a wrong).

verses.text: 於是有白袍賜給他們各人，又有話吩咐他們要安息一會兒，等到那些與他們同作僕人和弟兄，像他們一樣將要被殺的人，湊滿了數目的時候。

words.note: A formal or literary conjunction.
Often used in religious or formal contexts.
More formal than 每个人.
Formal verb, often used for divine or authoritative commands.
Often used for spiritual or Sabbath rest.
More formal than 和.
Often used in biblical phrases like 'fellow servants'.
Used as 'brethren' in a religious context.
Refers to a quota or a pre-destined number being reached.

verses.text: 羊羔揭開了第六個印的時候，我觀看，大地震就發生了。太陽變黑，像粗糙的黑毛布；整個月亮變紅，像血一樣；

words.note: In the Bible, often refers to Jesus Christ.
Literally 'black wool cloth'; commonly translates to 'sackcloth' in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 天上的星辰墜落在地上，像無花果樹被大風搖動，落下還沒有成熟的果子。

words.note: A more poetic or formal term for stars.
Literally 'flowerless fruit tree', referring to figs.

verses.text: 天隱退了，像書被捲起來一樣；山嶺和海島都從原處移去了。

words.note: Formal verb meaning to withdraw or vanish.
Contextually 'scroll' is more fitting for being 'rolled up'.
A collective term for mountain ranges.

verses.text: 地上的君王、大臣、軍長、財主、勇士和所有作奴隸的、自由的，都藏在山洞和巖穴裡。

words.note: Refers to a rich person, often with an implication of social standing.
Heroic or strong individuals, often warriors.
Refers to those who are not enslaved.
Refers to a natural hollow or cavern, often in rock.

verses.text: 他們向山嶺和巖石說：「倒在我們身上吧！把我們藏起來，躲避坐在寶座上那位的面，和羊羔的震怒！

words.note: Indicates upward movement, appearance, or beginning.
Lit. 'precious seat'.
A respectful way to refer to a specific person, here likely God.
Contextually 'face' often means 'presence' in biblical texts.
Refers to Jesus Christ in the Book of Revelation.
Lit. 'shaking anger', implying intense wrath.

verses.text: 因為他們震怒的大日子來到了，誰能站立得住呢？」

words.note: Here 'their' refers to 'that One' and 'the Lamb'.
Lit. 'shaking anger', implying intense wrath.
Verb-complement structure with completion particle.
A verb complement indicating ability to withstand or endure.
